item.title: Jet bundles or Bundles of Principal Parts
item.description: The Intuition Jet bundles are also known as bundles of principal part (more generally, modules of principal parts). Roughly speaking, sections of a jet bundle, called jets, are operators that send sections to Taylor polynomials. For example, for a function \(f\in\mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{A}^1}\), the second jet of \(f\) at the origin \(o\in \mathbb{A}^1\) is determined by \[ J_o^2 f= f(o)+Df(o)(x-o)+\frac{1}{2!}D^2f(o)(x-o)^2, \] where \(D\) the is the differential operator \(\frac{\partial}{\partial x}\). Consider a function \(f\in\mathcal{O}_{\mathbb{A}^n}\).
